body.p: IASC’s view—consistently reflected in previous proposals for intangible assets—was that there should be no difference between the requirements for:

li.p: intangible assets that are acquired externally; and
internally generated intangible assets, whether they arise from development activities or other types of activities.

body.p: Therefore, an internally generated intangible asset should be recognised whenever the definition of, and recognition criteria for, an intangible asset are met. This view was also supported by a majority of commentators on E60.
